title: From Kyiv to Taipei: Unraveling the impact of space on military power and Taiwan’s daunting prospects
summary: In the wake of the full-scale Russian invasion, global attention has focused on Western military support extended to Ukraine. Much of this recognition centers on the provision of conventional resources, […]

title: SpaceNews 2023 Icon Awards honorees: Space Stewardship
summary: This year’s Space Stewardship honorees include two pioneers in the field of space situational awareness and an industry-led initiative to foster best practices in on-orbit satellite servicing and related endeavors, including active removal of orbital debris.

title: Daily Telescope: An amazing, colorful view of the Universe
summary: Take a look at two clusters of galaxies that are colliding.

title: Has ESA Stacked the Deck for The Exploration Company?
summary:
With the announcement of its commercial cargo programme, the European Space Agency appears to have stacked the deck to allow for only one challenger to be eligible to compete. At the 2023 Space Summit in Spain, ESA member states endorsed a resolution directing the agency to create a programme that would see European companies develop […]
The post Has ESA Stacked the Deck for The Exploration Company? appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Halo Space, Eos X and Arthur D. Little Spain indicted for unlawful use of Zero 2 Infinity’s trade secrets
summary: The case stems from Zero 2 Infinity's allegations that the people and organizations the company hired to raise money for its space tourism business used the funds obtained from investors to establish competing businesses based on Zero 2 Infinity’s intellectual property.

title: SpaceX launches final pair of O3b mPower satellites needed for commercial services
summary: SpaceX launched a third pair of O3b mPower satellites Nov. 12, enough for SES to start services next year from a constellation grappling with electrical issues that have reduced initial capacity.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy November 12-18, 2023

title: Rogue Space launches its first demonstration mission on Transporter-9
summary: Rogue Space Systems launched its first demonstration mission Nov. 11 on the SpaceX Transporter-9 rideshare.

title: Saber Astronautics gets Space Force contract for data visualization software
summary: The U.S. Space Force awarded Saber Astronautics a $1.2 million contract to develop data visualization software focused on the cislunar region of space, between Earth and the moon’s orbit.

title: Foust Forward | Trick-or-treating at Venus
summary: The annual meeting of a scientific committee called the Venus Exploration Analysis Group, or VEXAG, coincided this year with Halloween. Befitting the occasion, there were both tricks and treats for scientists studying the planet Venus.
